html.main:
Cascading Style Sheets¶

Extension for creating style sheets using python.

To use this extension, add the lux.extensions.ui entry into the EXTENSIONS list in your config file. To add additional css rules, a user extension module must provide the add_css function which accept one parameter only, the css container. The add_css function is called when building the css file via the style command.

Requires: lux.extensions.base

Variables and Symbols¶

Symbolic¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.base.Symbolic[source]¶

Base class for Variable and Unit.

Variable¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.base.Variable[source]¶

Base class for Variable which can be stored in a Variables container.

value()[source]¶

The current value of this Variable.

Symbol¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.base.Symbol(name, value=None)[source]¶

A Variable with a name and an underlying value which can be another Variable.

value[source]¶

The value of this variable. It can be another Variable

Lazy¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.base.Lazy(callable, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A lazy Variable.

Parameters:callable – the callable invoked when accessing the

Variable.value() method of this lazy variable.

Variables¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.base.Variables(parent=None, name=None)[source]¶

A container of Variable with name-spaces:

v = Variables()
v.body.height = px(16)

If the body name-space is not available is automatically created.

name[source]¶

The name of this container of Variable.

parent[source]¶

The parent Variables container.

value()[source]¶

Provide the value method which returns None.

valid()[source]¶

True if the Variables are part of a root dictionary.

copy(parent=None, name=None)[source]¶

Copy the Variables in a recursive way.

params(recursive=False)[source]¶

Return this Variables container as a dictionary of named variables.

Spacing¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.base.Spacing(*top_right_bottom_left)[source]¶

Css spacing with same unit. It can be used to specify padding, margin or any other css parameters which requires spacing box of the form (top, right, bottom, left).

lux.extensions.ui.lib.base.spacing(v, *vals)[source]¶

Create a Spacing element.

Mixin¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.base.Mixin[source]¶

A css Mixin is a generator of css and other Mixin elements. All Mixin must implement the callable method which receives the css element which contains them.

Colours¶

RGBA¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.colorvar.RGBA[source]¶

CSS3 red-green-blue & alpha color definition. It contains conversions to and from HSL and HSV representations.

red¶

red light (0 to 255)

green¶

green light (0 to 255)

blue¶

blue light (0 to 255)

alpha¶

opacity level (0 to 1)

tohsla()[source]¶

Convert to HSL representation (hue, saturation, lightness). Note all values are number between 0 and 1. Therefore for the hue, to obtain the angle value you need to multiply by 360.

Return type:a four elements tuple containing hue, saturation, lightness, alpha
tohsva()[source]¶

Convert to HSV representation (hue, saturation, value). This is also called HSB (hue, saturation, brightness). Note all values are number between 0 and 1. Therefore for the hue, to obtain the angle value you need to multiply by 360.

Return type:a four elements tuple containing hue, saturation, value, alpha
darken(weight)[source]¶

Darken the color by a given weight in percentage. It return a new RGBA color with lightness decreased by that amount.

lighten(weight)[source]¶

Lighten the color by a given weight in percentage. It return a new RGBA color with lightness increased by that amount.

color¶

lux.extensions.ui.lib.colorvar.color(col, *cols, **kwargs)[source]¶

Build a RGBA or a lazy variable from several type of inputs.

Mixins¶

Bcd¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Bcd(background=None, color=None, text_shadow=None, text_decoration=None, border=None)[source]¶

Background-color-decorator Mixin.

It can be applied to any element and it forms the basis for the Clickable Mixin.

Parameters:
  • background – backgroud or css3 Gradient.
  • colour – text colour
  • text_shadow – text shadow
  • text_decoration – text decoration
  • border – Border or parameters for Border. If specified, the element will have a border definition.

Border¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Border(style=None, color=None, width=None, top=None, right=None, bottom=None, left=None)[source]¶

A Mixin for adding border to a css element.

Parameters:
  • color – border color. If not set no border color is specified.
  • style – border style. If not set, solid is used. Could be one of: solid, dotted, none.
  • width – border width. If not set 1px is used.

BoxSizing¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.BoxSizing(value=None)[source]¶

The box-sizing CSS3 property.

This property allows you to define certain elements to fit an area in a certain way.

The only parameter is value which can be one of:

  • content-box: This is the behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2. The specified width and height (and min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element. The padding and border of the element are laid out and drawn outside the specified width and height.
  • border-box: The specified width and height (and min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element. That is, any padding or border specified on the element is laid out and drawn inside this specified width and height. The content width and height are calculated by subtracting the border and padding widths of the respective sides from the specified ‘width’ and ‘height’ properties.
  • inherit

Clearfix¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Clearfix[source]¶

A clearfix is a way for an element to automatically clear after itself, so that you don’t need to add additional markup. It’s generally used in float layouts where elements are floated to be stacked horizontally.

Clickable¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Clickable(default=None, hover=None, active=None, cursor='pointer', **kwargs)[source]¶

Defines the default, hover and active state.

CssInclude¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.CssInclude(path, location=None, replace=None)[source]¶

Include one or more css resources. The correct use of this Mixin is within the body tag only:

css('body', CssInclude(path))

path can be both an internet address as well as a file in the local filesystem.

path¶

A valid file location or a fully qualified internet address

location¶

Optional relative location of imports. If specified url(...) entries in the css string will be modified.

replace¶

Optional string to replace just after a url( element in the css file.

Fontface¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Fontface(base, svg=None)[source]¶

Gradient¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Gradient(*args)[source]¶

css3 gradient. Don’t initialise directly, use gradient() instead.

direction¶

One of v for vertical, h for horizontal.

start¶

The start color.

end¶

The start color.

Opacity¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Opacity(o)[source]¶

Add opacity to an element.

param o: a number between 0 and 1.

Radius¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Radius(radius, location=None)[source]¶

css3 border radius. The optional location parameter specifies the location where to apply the radius. For example, ‘top’, ‘bottom’, ‘left’, ‘right’, ‘top-left’, ‘top-right’ and so on.

Shadow¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Shadow(hshadow=None, vshadow=None, blur=None, spread=None, color=None, inset=None)[source]¶

The box-shadow css3 property attaches one or more drop-shadows to the box. The property is a comma-separated list of shadows, each specified by 2-4 length values, an optional color, and an optional inset keyword. Omitted lengths are 0:

Shadow(hshadow, vshadow, blur, spread, color, inset)
hshadow¶

The position of the horizontal shadow. Negative values are allowed.

vshadow¶

The position of the vertical shadow. Negative values are allowed.

blur¶

Optional blur distance.

spread¶

The size of shadow.

color¶

Optional color of the shadow.

inset¶

Optional boolean to changes the shadow from an outer shadow (outset) to an inner shadow.

Stack¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Stack(*mixins)[source]¶

Stack Stackable mixins.

Transition¶

class lux.extensions.ui.lib.mixins.Transition(property, duration=None, easing=None, delay=None)[source]¶

Define a CSS3 transition.

A transition is controlled via the following parameters:

property¶

Specifies the name or comma separated names of the CSS properties to which transitions should be applied. Only properties listed here are animated during transitions; changes to all other properties occur instantaneously as usual.

Valid values are: opacity, left, top, height, all and so forth.

duration¶

Specifies the duration over which transitions should occur. You can specify a single duration that applies to all properties during the transition, or multiple values to allow each property to transition over a different period of time.

Valid value is a string of type 0.5s, 2s, 5s and so forth.

easing¶

The easing function to use. Default: linear.

delay¶

Defines how long to wait between the time a property is changed and the transition actually begins.
